verses.verse: If a <S%H376>man<s%> shall <S%H1589>steal<s%> an <S%H7794>ox<s%>, or a <S%H7716>sheep<s%>, and <S%H2873>kill<s%> it, or <S%H4376>sell<s%> it; he shall <S%H7999>restore<s%> <S%H2568>five<s%> <S%H1241>oxen<s%> for an <S%H7794>ox<s%>, and <S%H702>four<s%> <S%H6629>sheep<s%> for a <S%H7716>sheep<s%>.
¶ If a <S%H1590>thief<s%> be <S%H4672>found<s%> breaking <S%H4290>up<s%>, and be <S%H5221>smitten<s%> that he <S%H4191>die<s%>, there shall no <S%H1818>blood<s%> be shed for him.

If the <S%H8121>sun<s%> be <S%H2224>risen<s%> upon him, there shall be <S%H1818>blood<s%> shed for him; for he should make <S%H7999>full<s%> <S%H7999>restitution<s%>; if he have nothing, then he shall be <S%H4376>sold<s%> for his <S%H1591>theft<s%>.

If the <S%H1591>theft<s%> be <S%H4672>certainly<s%> <S%H4672>found<s%> in his <S%H3027>hand<s%> <S%H2416>alive<s%>, whether it be <S%H7794>ox<s%>, or <S%H2543>ass<s%>, or <S%H7716>sheep<s%>; he shall <S%H7999>restore<s%> <S%H8147>double<s%>.

¶ If a <S%H376>man<s%> shall cause a <S%H7704>field<s%> or <S%H3754>vineyard<s%> to be <S%H1197>eaten<s%>, and shall <S%H7971>put<s%> in his <S%H1165>beast<s%>, and shall <S%H1197>feed<s%> in another <S%H312>man's<s%> <S%H7704>field<s%>; of the <S%H4315>best<s%> of his own <S%H7704>field<s%>, and of the <S%H4315>best<s%> of his own <S%H3754>vineyard<s%>, shall he make <S%H7999>restitution<s%>.

¶ If <S%H784>fire<s%> break <S%H3318>out<s%>, and <S%H4672>catch<s%> in <S%H6975>thorns<s%>, so that the stacks of <S%H1430>corn<s%>, or the standing <S%H7054>corn<s%>, or the <S%H7704>field<s%>, be <S%H398>consumed<s%> therewith; he that <S%H1197>kindled<s%> the <S%H1200>fire<s%> shall <S%H7999>surely<s%> make <S%H7999>restitution<s%>.

¶ If a <S%H376>man<s%> shall <S%H5414>deliver<s%> unto his <S%H7453>neighbour<s%> <S%H3701>money<s%> or <S%H3627>stuff<s%> to <S%H8104>keep<s%>, and it be <S%H1589>stolen<s%> out of the <S%H376>man's<s%> <S%H1004>house<s%>; if the <S%H1590>thief<s%> be <S%H4672>found<s%>, let him <S%H7999>pay<s%> <S%H8147>double<s%>.

If the <S%H1590>thief<s%> be <S%H3808>not<s%> <S%H4672>found<s%>, then the <S%H1167>master<s%> of the <S%H1004>house<s%> shall be <S%H7126>brought<s%> unto the <S%H430>judges<s%>, to see whether he have <S%H7971>put<s%> his <S%H3027>hand<s%> unto his <S%H7453>neighbour's<s%> <S%H4399>goods<s%>.

For all <S%H1697>manner<s%> of <S%H6588>trespass<s%>, whether it be for <S%H7794>ox<s%>, for <S%H2543>ass<s%>, for <S%H7716>sheep<s%>, for <S%H8008>raiment<s%>, or for any manner of lost <S%H9>thing<s%>, which another <S%H559>challengeth<s%> to be his, the <S%H1697>cause<s%> of both <S%H8147>parties<s%> shall <S%H935>come<s%> before the <S%H430>judges<s%>; and whom the <S%H430>judges<s%> shall <S%H7561>condemn<s%>, he shall <S%H7999>pay<s%> <S%H8147>double<s%> unto his <S%H7453>neighbour<s%>.

If a <S%H376>man<s%> <S%H5414>deliver<s%> unto his <S%H7453>neighbour<s%> an <S%H2543>ass<s%>, or an <S%H7794>ox<s%>, or a <S%H7716>sheep<s%>, or any <S%H929>beast<s%>, to <S%H8104>keep<s%>; and it <S%H4191>die<s%>, or be <S%H7665>hurt<s%>, or driven <S%H7617>away<s%>, no man <S%H7200>seeing<s%> it:

Then shall an <S%H7621>oath<s%> of the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> be between them <S%H8147>both<s%>, that he hath not <S%H7971>put<s%> his <S%H3027>hand<s%> unto his <S%H7453>neighbour's<s%> <S%H4399>goods<s%>; and the <S%H1167>owner<s%> of it shall <S%H3947>accept<s%> thereof, and he shall not make it <S%H7999>good<s%>.
And if it be <S%H1589%H1589>stolen<s%> from him, he shall make <S%H7999>restitution<s%> unto the <S%H1167>owner<s%> thereof.
If it be torn in <S%H2963%H2963>pieces<s%>, then let him <S%H935>bring<s%> it for <S%H5707>witness<s%>, and he shall not make <S%H7999>good<s%> that which was <S%H2966>torn<s%>.

¶ And if a <S%H376>man<s%> <S%H7592>borrow<s%> ought of his <S%H7453>neighbour<s%>, and it be <S%H7665>hurt<s%>, or <S%H4191>die<s%>, the <S%H1167>owner<s%> thereof being not with <S%H5973>it<s%>, he shall <S%H7999>surely<s%> make it <S%H7999>good<s%>.
But if the <S%H1167>owner<s%> thereof be with it, he shall not make it <S%H7999>good<s%>: if it be an <S%H7916>hired<s%> thing, it <S%H935>came<s%> for his <S%H7939>hire<s%>.

¶ And if a <S%H376>man<s%> <S%H6601>entice<s%> a <S%H1330>maid<s%> that is not <S%H781>betrothed<s%>, and <S%H7901>lie<s%> with her, he shall <S%H4117>surely<s%> <S%H4117>endow<s%> her to be his <S%H802>wife<s%>.

If her <S%H1>father<s%> <S%H3985>utterly<s%> <S%H3985>refuse<s%> to <S%H5414>give<s%> her unto him, he shall <S%H8254>pay<s%> <S%H3701>money<s%> according to the <S%H4119>dowry<s%> of <S%H1330>virgins<s%>.
¶ Thou shalt not suffer a <S%H3784>witch<s%> to <S%H2421>live<s%>.
¶ Whosoever <S%H7901>lieth<s%> with a <S%H929>beast<s%> shall <S%H4191>surely<s%> be put to <S%H4191>death<s%>.
¶ He that <S%H2076>sacrificeth<s%> unto any <S%H430>god<s%>, <S%H1115>save<s%> unto the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> only, he shall be utterly <S%H2763>destroyed<s%>.
¶ Thou shalt neither <S%H3238>vex<s%> a <S%H1616>stranger<s%>, nor <S%H3905>oppress<s%> him: for ye were <S%H1616>strangers<s%> in the <S%H776>land<s%> of <S%H4714>Egypt<s%>.
¶ Ye shall not <S%H6031>afflict<s%> any <S%H490>widow<s%>, or fatherless <S%H3490>child<s%>.
<S%H518>If<s%> thou <S%H6031>afflict<s%> them in any <S%H6031>wise<s%>, and they <S%H6817>cry<s%> at <S%H6817>all<s%> unto me, I will <S%H8085>surely<s%> <S%H8085>hear<s%> their <S%H6818>cry<s%>;

And my <S%H639>wrath<s%> shall wax <S%H2734>hot<s%>, and I will <S%H2026>kill<s%> you with the <S%H2719>sword<s%>; and your <S%H802>wives<s%> shall be <S%H490>widows<s%>, and your <S%H1121>children<s%> <S%H3490>fatherless<s%>.

¶ If thou <S%H3867>lend<s%> <S%H3701>money<s%> to any of my <S%H5971>people<s%> that is <S%H6041>poor<s%> by thee, thou shalt not be to him as an <S%H5383>usurer<s%>, neither shalt thou <S%H7760>lay<s%> upon him <S%H5392>usury<s%>.

If thou at <S%H2254>all<s%> <S%H2254>take<s%> thy <S%H7453>neighbour's<s%> <S%H8008>raiment<s%> to <S%H2254>pledge<s%>, thou shalt <S%H7725>deliver<s%> it unto him <S%H5704>by<s%> that the <S%H8121>sun<s%> goeth <S%H935>down<s%>:

For that is his <S%H3682>covering<s%> only, it is his <S%H8071>raiment<s%> for his <S%H5785>skin<s%>: wherein shall he <S%H7901>sleep<s%>? and it shall come to pass, when he <S%H6817>crieth<s%> unto me, that I will <S%H8085>hear<s%>; for I am <S%H2587>gracious<s%>.
¶ Thou shalt not <S%H7043>revile<s%> the <S%H430>gods<s%>, nor <S%H779>curse<s%> the <S%H5387>ruler<s%> of thy <S%H5971>people<s%>.

¶ Thou shalt not <S%H309>delay<s%> to offer the first of thy ripe <S%H4395>fruits<s%>, and of thy <S%H1831>liquors<s%>: the <S%H1060>firstborn<s%> of thy <S%H1121>sons<s%> shalt thou <S%H5414>give<s%> unto me.

<S%H3651>Likewise<s%> shalt thou <S%H6213>do<s%> with thine <S%H7794>oxen<s%>, and with thy <S%H6629>sheep<s%>: <S%H7651>seven<s%> <S%H3117>days<s%> it shall be with his <S%H517>dam<s%>; on the <S%H8066>eighth<s%> <S%H3117>day<s%> thou shalt <S%H5414>give<s%> it me.

¶ And ye shall be <S%H6944>holy<s%> <S%H582>men<s%> unto me: neither shall ye <S%H398>eat<s%> any <S%H1320>flesh<s%> that is torn of <S%H2966>beasts<s%> in the <S%H7704>field<s%>; ye shall <S%H7993>cast<s%> it to the <S%H3611>dogs<s%>.
